image.altText: Screengrab of mobile vision showing people with blurred faces standing under an awning.

props.synopsis: Greens MP Tammy Franks has used parliamentary privilege to say a man arrested near Port Augusta earlier this month was treated for a skull fracture and a broken rib.

title.children: Man shoved by SA Police officer was treated for skull fracture and broken rib, Greens MP says

image.altText: Whooping cough cases on the rise in Tasmania

props.synopsis: South Australia is currently experiencing a whooping cough wave, with the number of reported cases already climbing to 1,349.

title.children: South Australia experiencing 'massive' whooping cough wave with numbers 13 times higher than last year

image.altText: Close up photo of a baby wrapped in white blankets being held by a woman, neither of whom are identifiable

props.synopsis: Krystal says she had one baby removed by South Australia's Department for Child Protection at the hospital, making her 'petrified' to go anywhere near a hospital the next time she got pregnant. She had a breached labour at home without any assistance. Three months later, police kicked in her door and took the newborn.

title.children: Child protection workers knocked on the delivery room door as Krystal was giving birth. The next time she refused to go to hospital

image.altText: An autism advocate at a media conference.

props.synopsis: The expansion of South Australia's disability parking permit scheme to include people with cognitive, behavioural and neurological conditions is welcomed by autism advocate and mother Tegan Cross, who says her sons "have every right to do everything else that everybody else does".

title.children: Disability parking at SA public places to be expanded to include autistic people

image.altText: A sketch of a convicted murderer and rapist in court

props.synopsis: James Beauregard-Smith was jailed for murdering his former partner Sandra Holland and her two sons Craig, 9, and Scott, 11, in July 1977. Just a week after he was granted parole, he raped a 21-year-old woman and has remained in custody ever since.

title.children: Triple murderer and rapist dubbed 'one of the worst criminals' in SA dies in custody

image.altText: A man talking to someone.

props.synopsis: Just before midnight on Wednesday, the South Australian parliament passed a raft of changes to how politics runs in the state. Here's a look at what has changed.

title.children: SA Labor says it's 'world-leading', the Australia Institute calls it 'undemocratic'. Here's what the reform bill means for the next election

image.altText: Rayan Ramadan with dark hair pulled back and Mariya Zaghwan with cream hajib smile with arms around one another

props.synopsis: There are many ways coercive control can present itself in intimate partner relationships. Now, some states and territories are moving to criminalise it as young people take part in education programs aimed at stamping it out.

title.children: What is coercive control? This program is educating young people to help call it out

image.altText: A white man with dark hair wearing a black suit and chequred shirt crosses his arms in front of the RAA shop in Broken Hill

props.synopsis: The Broken Hill City Council has voted to withdraw from Local Government NSW, alleging the body does not empathise with or prioritise regional mining communities.

title.children: Mining town walks away from state council body over concerns it keeps 'targeting regional NSW'

image.altText: Simon Birmingham stands in the senate chamber.

props.synopsis: Opposition Senate leader Simon Birmingham has announced he will retire from politics after 17 years to move in a "commercially orientated" direction.

title.children: Liberal senator Simon Birmingham to retire from politics at the next election

image.altText: A man kneeling next to a closed cat trap

props.synopsis: Leg traps, cages and AI gel sprayers are being deployed against feral cats on Kangaroo Island, but the Invasive Species Council says it could all be for nothing without a change in the law.

title.children: Calls to change 'archaic' restriction on trapping feral cats as animals get more cunning

image.altText: a composite of a young man with blonde hair with a bowl of cucumber

props.synopsis: Cucumbers are this year's unlikely viral sensation on social media, spurring a 30 per cent spike in sales among younger Australians and shortages in places like Iceland.

title.children: Viral TikTok cucumber recipes drive up sales as younger Australians smash a salad

image.altText: Leeroy Bilney

props.synopsis: As SA's Voice to Parliament delivered its historic first speech, some are calling for faith in its ability to create meaningful change. But critics say they are not opposed to axing the body altogether.

title.children: 'We are determined to prove you wrong': South Australia's Voice to Parliament makes first address

image.altText: A woman speaking on a TV

props.synopsis: Australia's social media ban for children makes headlines around the world, including as far away as Russia, as articles question how it could work and whether similar laws would be introduced elsewhere.

title.children: World-first social media ban on children in 'Land of Kangaroos' makes global headlines

image.altText: A woman’s hands holding a smartphone, surrounded by messages of upset emojis

props.synopsis: Technology giants respond to the government's new social media laws banning those under 16, meeting the "rushed process" with "concern" and disappointment.

title.children: 'Concerned' and 'disappointed' tech companies respond to Australia's social media ban

image.altText: An Indigenous man with long grey hair leaves court.

props.synopsis: The 72-year-old south-west Victorian Indigenous leader has been jailed for six years and two months over 25 fraud-related charges.

title.children: Former ATSIC head Geoff Clark jailed for defrauding Framlingham Indigenous community

image.altText: A Ukrainian officer next to a downed Shahed drone pointing to a thermobaric charge beside it.

props.synopsis: Russia is carrying out record mass drone attacks on Ukraine, and experts say its new foam decoys and thermobaric warheads were making them more devastating and difficult to defend against.

title.children: Russia is using foam drones and 'vacuum' bomb Shaheds to carry out devastating mass attacks on Ukraine

image.altText: Composite Andrew David and Maurice Hawell outside court

props.synopsis: Three men from Sydney have been sentenced to prison over their sexual assaults against three women in their late teens, with the longest term being 14 years.

title.children: Bucks party trio handed lengthy jail sentences for 'cold, callous, degrading' gang rape of three women

image.altText: Side by side photos of the Treasurer Jim Chalmers looking serious and Michele Bullock, gesturing with her hand mid-speech

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers has confirmed he'd like to see sweeping changes made to the structure of the Reserve Bank before the next election.

title.children: The Reserve Bank is in for major changes, but it won't mean much for interest rates

image.altText: Joe biden seen against a black background looking serious

props.synopsis: With just a few weeks left of his political career, speculation is mounting about who President Joe Biden might pardon before he leaves office and hands over power to Donald Trump.

title.children: With just weeks left in power, Biden has some big, controversial names to consider for pardons

image.altText: Putin standing at a podium

props.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin has threatened to use new Oreshnik hypersonic missile to attack "decision-making centres" in Kyiv in response to Ukraine's firing of Western missiles at Russian territory.

title.children: Vladimir Putin threatens to use new Oreshnik hypersonic missile to attack 'decision-making centres' in Kyiv

image.altText: A white background is tiled with mobile versions of webstores. In the foreground are desktop versions

props.synopsis: An ABC NEWS Verify investigation has uncovered dozens of online clothing stores pretending to be high-end Australian fashion boutiques. Customers are sometimes shipped cheap, low-quality goods made in Asia, and sometimes, nothing at all.

title.children: We uncovered 57 online clothing shops trying to scam Australians. And they're just the tip of the iceberg

image.altText: A blurry image of a boat sinking

props.synopsis: Mistakes by members of the crew caused a New Zealand navy ship to plough into a reef off the coast of Samoa, where it caught fire and sank, according to the preliminary findings of a military Court of Inquiry.

title.children: Inquiry reveals crew errors sank New Zealand navy ship off Samoa

image.altText: Two people wearing red life jackets sitting on a long blue vessel partially submerged in the ocean

props.synopsis: A wood and fibreglass semi-submersible vessel was intercepted in the Pacific Ocean as part of a six-week operation that seized 225 tonnes of cocaine.

title.children: Colombia uncovers new Australian drug trafficking route after Pacific Ocean cocaine bust

image.altText: Stock image of a Virgin plane

props.synopsis: Despite finishing lower for the day, the ASX has ended the week higher, while the ACCC has given interim clearance to an alliance between Virgin Australia and Qatar Airways.

title.children: Virgin-Qatar deal cleared for take-off, Cbus faces Senate grilling, ASX ends the week higher — as it happened

image.altText: A man walking on a road in front of a pile of rubble

props.synopsis: Israel's military said on Thursday it had detected "suspects" in several areas in southern Lebanon, calling this a violation of a ceasefire with Hezbollah.

title.children: Israel and Hezbollah accuse each other of breaching two-day-old ceasefire

image.altText: Sun shines against power pole in NSW.

props.synopsis: The latest independent scorecard shows that Australia is falling behind in its bid to meet the government's legislated 2030 target.

title.children: Australia falls dramatically short of 2030 emissions reduction goal, latest independent scorecard shows

image.altText: A young man wearing a puma shirt in front of a fence.

props.synopsis: Sam was missing for 50 days as temperatures dropped to -20 degrees Celsius and snow fell across the alpine tundras and rocky peaks of Redfern-Keily Provincial Park.

title.children: Canadian man found alive after 50 days in snowy wilderness

image.altText: Virat Kohli batting during a training session.

props.synopsis: India has dominated Australia in Test cricket for the past decade but as New Zealand recently showed the key to beating the Men in Blue may lie in players who hail from South Asia.

title.children: 'We take cricket with us': Why the face of Australian cricket must change

image.altText: PFAS firefighting foam

props.synopsis: Researchers of a new study into how a type of PFAS breaks down in the environment say their findings underline the need to better monitor a wider range of "forever chemicals".

title.children: Soon-to-be-banned 'forever chemical' more widespread than previously thought

image.altText: A black-and-white imge of a young man leaning in a doorway.

props.synopsis: It is a case that likely to have ramifications for all rental property owners in relation to providing to working smoke alarms.

title.children: Landlord appeals $250k damages payout after being found negligent over death of tenant

image.altText: A side on shot of a man wearing a black suit next to a woman in a black blazer walking looking ahead.

props.synopsis: Kristian White remains on bail, avoiding time behind bars ahead of sentencing for the manslaughter of 95-year-old Clare Nowland in an aged-care home.

title.children: Family of 95yo who died after being tasered by cop 'struggling to understand' why he remains on bail after guilty verdict

image.altText: A woman with beige headphones and a tote bag walks past a shop window advertising 50 per cent off.

props.synopsis: Australians are set to spend almost $7 billion in just four days during this year's Black Friday-Cyber Monday sales, as the cost of living sees more shoppers eager to snap up a bargain.

title.children: Black Friday sales set to be the biggest on record despite cost-of-living pressures

image.altText: A white Powerball lotto ticket with a black logo and lottery numbers and red coding messages on each side

props.synopsis: A mystery winner from Melbourne has come forward to claim his share of the latest Powerball prize, following the earlier announcement of a Queensland couple as winning ticket holders.

title.children: Powerball $100 million lotto's second jackpot winner revealed

image.altText: A man holds a big camera while a person wipes their eye

props.synopsis: Police clashed with pro-EU protesters in Georgia's capital Tbilisi after the ruling party said it would suspend talks on European Union accession until 2028. They used used water cannons, pepper spray and tear gas, injuring journalists in the process.

title.children: Journalists injured as Georgian police clash with protesters against EU accession delay

image.altText: Woman with dog

props.synopsis: Animal shelters say they rely on being able to post on Facebook to get thousands of animals adopted each year.

title.children: Animals build up in shelters after Meta's AI tool deletes adoption Facebook posts
